title.narrative: Climate Change policy devlopmnt Phase II

description.narrative: LEAD Pakistan and ONL CO, Pakistan has come across a prime opportunity of contributing to development of climate change policies ofthe two of the provincial governments of Pakistan. The project has been divided into two phases: i) Review of existing policies, practices, formulation and convening of provincial steering committee, initial consultations ii) Consultations to develop the design <(>&<)> draft of the policies/ The Environmental Protection Agency, Environment Department Government of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa is executing an ADP Project titled #Establishment of Climate Change Cell for MEA in EPA, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KP)#. The main goal of the Climate Change Cell is to establish an institutional mechanism for coordination with stakeholders and formulate provincial Climate Changepolicy and provincial action plan for implementation of the MEAs signed by the Government of Pakistan in close consultation with relevant provincial line departments and other stakeholders. The Provincial Climate Change Policy document and the MEAAP will be submitted to the Cabinet of the Government of KP for final approval and implementation by the Provincial Government. LEAD Pakistan has been appointed by the EPA (KP) to Draft the Provincial Climate Change Policy for Approval of the Government Khyber Pakhtunkhwa. LEAD Pakistan is also currently supporting the Government of Punjab in developing its provincial Climate Change Policy. The project is funded by Oxfam Novib. Taking forward the learning from the experience of KPK, LEAD Pakistan is working closely with the Planning <(>&<)> Development department, to ensure that the policy is streamlined with all other major provincial policies. Additionally, LEAD Pakistan has been a major contributor to the design and formulation of the National Climate Change Policy and its subsequent framework for implementation. LEAD continues to contribute in the form of country stances for major events such as the Conference of Parties. In collaboration with Oxfam Novib, LEAD Pakistan developed the Pakistan country paper for the WCDRR earlier this year. This proposalenvisages the designing of Provincial Climate Change Policy based on specific sectoral needs for the province of Sindh. In order todevelop the policy the project will adopt a participatory approach, through situation analysis, research and capacity building as well as consultations with relevant stakeholders. The target audience will be multi-sectoral and will include policy makers (elected and appointed); civil society organizations especially those working in the field of environment and/or Climate Change; academia, specialists (including researchers and practitioners in environment and Climate Change field), media, students, youth and community representatives. The main outcome of the project is one policy for adaptation and mitigation in the face of Climate Change in the province of Sindh.

participating-org.narrative: Lead Pakistan is part of the international consortium of LEAD Organisations, originally started in the United States but now with its HQ in the United Kingdom. It specialises in capacity building and training in leadership around the world. In Pakistan its main focus has been on enviromental change and the consequences, and on working with volunteers, which is where this project stems from.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood

description.narrative: Improved policies: # of cases where Oxfam/partners influenced governments or global actors in adopting/implementating policies on (i) Sustainable Food production and consumption, (ii) Land Rights and (iii) Climate Change with a gender senstive lens.
